alert.note: Alert for Potomac, Seeley Lake Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 21 at 2:30PM MDT until October 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 PM MDT SUNDAY ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches with 10 to 15 inches above 6000 feet. Lower snow totals of 1 to 4 inches at valley locations, including Seeley Lake. * WHERE...Potomac/Seeley Lake Region. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 6 PM MDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel may become very difficult. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...Backcountry enthusiasts and hunters should be prepared for wintry conditions and the potential for hypothermia if caught in a storm unprepared.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
